    public class CcddFrameHandler
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    CFS Command and Data Dictionary frame handler class

    • Method Detail

      • closeFrame

        protected void closeFrame()
        Close the window

      • windowCloseButtonAction

        protected void windowCloseButtonAction()
        Handle the frame close button press event. The default is to activate the last button in the frame's button panel (close/cancel)

      • windowClosedAction

        protected void windowClosedAction()
        Placeholder for any actions required when this window is closed. This is intended to handle special actions for non-modal windows

      • getMinimumWidth

        protected int getMinimumWidth()
        Get the frame minimum width
        Returns:
        Frame minimum width

      • getTableWidth

        protected int getTableWidth()
        Get the total width of the table to be displayed in the window which is the sum of the minimum column sizes
        Returns:
        Total width, in pixels, of the minimum column sizes of the table to be displayed in the window

      • setTableWidth

        protected void setTableWidth(int width)
        Set the total width of the table to be displayed in the window which is the sum of the minimum column sizes
        Parameters:
        width - total width, in pixels, of the minimum column sizes of the table to be displayed in the window

      • adjustFrameMinimumWidth

        protected void adjustFrameMinimumWidth(int width)
        Adjust the minimum allowed window width
        Parameters:
        width - window's minimum allowed width, in pixels

      • verifySelection

        protected boolean verifySelection()
        Placeholder for method to verify the the window box selection(s) prior to closing
        Returns:
        true

      • setButtonWidth

        protected void setButtonWidth()
        Extract the window's button(s) from the supplied panel, then find the widest button calculated from the button's text and icon. Set the width of the panel containing the buttons based on the widest button

      • setButtonRows

        protected void setButtonRows(int rows)
        Set the number of rows occupied by the window's buttons
        Parameters:
        rows - number of window button rows

      • setControlsEnabled

        protected void setControlsEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable the button panel buttons. Override to include other frame controls
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the buttons; false to disable

      • createFrame

        protected void createFrame(java.awt.Component parent,
                           javax.swing.JComponent upperComponent,
                           javax.swing.JPanel buttonPnl,
                           javax.swing.JButton defaultBtn,
                           java.lang.String title,
                           CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType)
        Create the window. If no buttons are provided (lower panel) then create the buttons and button listeners needed based on the option type
        Parameters:
        parent - window to center the window over
        upperComponent - upper window components
        buttonPnl - panel containing the window's buttons; null if a defined option type is used
        defaultBtn - reference to the JButton that is actuated if the Enter key is pressed; null to have no default button
        title - title to display in the window frame
        optionType - dialog type: LOAD_OPTION, SAVE_OPTION, SEARCH_OPTION, READ_OPTION, PRINT_OPTION, CLOSE_OPTION, OK_OPTION, or OK_CANCEL_OPTION; ignored if buttonPnl isn't null
